text: A medieval PERSIAN ARMY camped on a forbidding mountain slope, twelve thousand feet high. A group of battle-scarred SOLDIERS cluster around a pair men playing DICE, kibitzing and making side bets. A heap of trinkets and coins is piled on the ground. One the GAMBLERS is a big BRUTE with rotted and missing teeth produces a golden bangle and drops it in the pot. All eye turn to his opponent...

Who sits calmly with his back to us. We haven’t seen his face yet but his very stillness sets him apart. He’s as grimy and battle-worn as the rest but his armor and dress of higher quality. Dastan unfastens his own studded-leather wrist guard. Displays it for all to see; drops it on the pile. The men crane eagerly as Dastan rolls.. THREE: a bad roll The BRUTISH SOLDIER leers and scoops up the dice. CLOSE ON HIS HANDS as he secretly swaps the dice before rolling... A TWELVE! Groans from the crowd as the Brutish Soldier ra in his winnings...
Ha! Kismet smiles upon me again.

I can think of other explanations... The Brutish Soldier looks up. Reveal Dastan’s face: Early 20s with the slim bearing of a natural athlete, he’ a nobler stamp than this gang of common soldiers yet completely at ease in their midst.
Careful friend. Nobody likes a sore loser.
I’m not a sore loser. I just don’t like being cheated. The other soldiers fall silent. Uh oh. The Brutish Soldier glares at Dastan and shrugs off his cloak. Massive chest and arms. He stands.
Let’s see how you like a beating then... Then he stops short because: THE POINT OF DASTAN’S DAGGER is an inch away from his fac We barely saw Dastan pull it out -- he’s that quick.

I have a better suggestion: one more wager. Everything you’ve won against this... Dastan removes the dagger from the man’s face and flips i catching it by the blade. He offers the jeweled handle to the Brutish Soldier. It looks valuable...
Those are real emeralds.
(examines it warily) A roll of the dice?
No, a test of skill-- I’1l take a single throw of the knife from fifteen paces. The Brutish Soldier raises an eyebrow. Fifteen paces is a long throw... he nods acceptance.

An “X” is MARKED on a WOOD POST with a piece of charcoal. The Brutish Soldier counts out fifteen generous paces and draws a line in the dirt with his boot. Dastan steps up. He flips the dagger in his hand several times, concentrating like a pitcher on the mound. All eyes are on him. Various soldiers call out encouragement: take your time, don’t rush, etc... Dastan takes aim, cocks his arm and...
Prince Dastan! «throws! The dagger sails off target and.. KA-THUNK stick a wooden barrel. A HERALD arrives at a breathless gallop.
Prince Dastan, your brothers summon you. The soldiers look around, uncertain who he is talking to. Slowly it dawns on them that he’s addressing Dastan.
All right. I’m on my way. The Brutish Soldier’s face is suddenly filled with fear. pulls the dagger free and hurries to return it to Dastan, going down on one knee...
My Lord... I-I had no idea.. please forgive me...
A bet’s a bet. Keep it. The Herald offers his horse and Dastan swings himself in the saddle. The Brutish Soldier watches him go with grudg admiration.
CLOSE ON the PRISONER’S FACE, drenched in sweat. Two guar hold him up while a third brings a lit torch close...

Stop! The prisoner has had enough. NIZAM, the king’s Grand Vizier (50s, cultured and wise) g the prisoner a sip of water, which he gulps gratefully. The four PRINCES watch the interrogation. Dastan is the youngest. Next are the twins, FARHAD and FARHAN -- identical, equally fastidious aristocrats who don’t like get their gleaming armor dirty. The eldest is TUS, a toug battle-hardened commander.

Question him again, Nizam; he will tell us who has been supplying our enemy with weapons and armor or he shall face the consequences. Nizam addresses the prisoner in a FOREIGN tongue.. the ma nods in surrender and whispers his response. Nizam reacts with surprise, then turns to face the others.
Noble princes. The prisoner begs for mercy. He has confessed the identity of their secret ally.. He points to a spot on a parchment map with Arabic calligraphy. The four brothers crane to see.
It is the city of Alamut that has been arming our enemy.
(frowns ) Alamut? (MORE )
I thought they were rumored to be an ancient race of holy people...
What care we for rumors, brother? If they have sided with our foe, then Alamut must pay the price. Tus gives his younger brother a stern look.
Our father, the King, would not decide so rashly. I will consider all arguments. Farhan clears his throat-- his brother speaks:
Does Alamut have treasure?
He’s only asking because it has been a long campaign...
We're thinking of the men.
Exactly.
Treasure. Food. Beautiful women. Alamut is renowned for them.
Nevermind the plunder-- the friend of our enemy is our enemy. Tus remains undecided.
I would have more proof.

I’m afraid the proof you seek lies within the walls of Alamut itself: secret forges, swords, spears... but Alamut is a mighty Citadel that has never fallen. You would risk much to attempt it, Prince. He bows deeply: the decision is not his to make.

What say you, brothers? Dastan draws his sword, a thirst for glory in his eyes. Farhad and Farhan follow suit -- a thirst for treasure in theirs. Tus looks at them. swayed, he draws his sword as well.
Then let their fortress come down.

A SERIES OF SHOTS: Footsoldiers on the move. Catapults pushed on wheels. The Persian Cavalry on horseback. PULL BACK TO REVEAL... an ever greater number of soldiers the army’s advance gains momentum...

Emerges from the morning fog. Thousands of men and horses A stunning, fearsome sight. Ahead, in the shadow of the mountain, a massive fortress rises from the mist like the home of the gods... THE CITADEL OF ALAMUT. Ancient, mysterious and impregnabl The common soldiers at Dastan’s side look shaken and make superstitious gestures to ward off evil.
They say the Alamut are sorcerers. Black magic.
I expect they’re flesh and bone, like us. Dastan rides ahead to join his older brothers on the ridg completing a quartet of horsemen. The PRINCES take in Alamut for the first time with their eyes.
We're going to get dirty, aren’t we?
You only get dirty if you actually fight. Do that and I’1l polish your armor for you.
(looks Dastan up and down) You’d do better to polish your own.
Come. Let’s make our father proud. They gallop off.

Gossamer curtains billow in the breeze. A girl tosses in fitful sleep. Smooth limbs, long black hair -- the darkne offers only a tantalizing hint of the beauty that is TAMI A GONG rings out. Tamina awakens, alarmed.
A SENTRY beats a giant GONG. ALAMUT SOLDIERS run past shouting in Foreign.

THE PERSIAN ARMY charges up the wide shaly slope. Tus, galloping ahead, lifts his sword and lets out a WAR From the ranks rises a blood-curdling NOISE as thousands voices join him. Then... A FLAMING ARROW is fired from the ramparts. All eyes turn skyward to follow its arc. At its apex, the arrow suddenly EXPLODES into a shower of brilliant white fireworks, illuminating the attacking arm

Is mesmerized; the Persians have never seen gunpowder bef Suddenly an ARROW fells the man next to him. Dastan instinctively raises his shield, blocking another ARROW.  Dastan’s eagle eye spots ALAMUT ARCHERS hidden among the rocks above. They’re clad in black, like ninjas.
There! Persian archers return fire. Tus, in the vanguard shouts-
To the walls! Attack!

Like the ocean tide crashing against a sea wall, the firs wave of footsoldiers reaches the citadel. Ladders are thr up; men scale the walls-- ALAMUT SOLDIERS, rise from hiding to meet them with arrow and burning oil. Persian soldiers and ladders fall. The battlefield is chaos. All around, men are felled by arrows. Dastan spots the problem -- ninja-like ALAMUT SABOTEURS darting like shadows among the troops.

The enemy is here! Dastan gallops toward a SABOTEUR who’s just doused a cata with oil. Leaping from horseback onto the catapult, he strikes the torch from the man’s hand before he can light They clash swords. The Saboteur, an intimidating spectre swathed in black is a formidable swordsman. But Dastan ho his own with surprising skill. A SECOND SABOTEUR joins in. Despite Dastan’s speed and agility, the two Saboteurs inexorably force him up onto t catapult platform. While #1 keeps him busy, #2 lights a torch. The catapult BURSTS INTO FLAMES. Dastan battles on with determination, heedless of the FLA rising around him. At last he turns the tables and knocks both Saboteurs off the platform into the flames. A moment of satisfaction... Then Dastan sees the TIE ROPE burning. Uh oh. He looks down, realizes what he’s standing on... Just as the ROPE BURNS THROUGH. The catapult arm FLINGS Dastan into the air. He soars to the ramparts...

Alamut SOLDIERS, fighting off the invaders, look up to se enemy soldier hurtling toward them like a cannonball. Whizzing over their heads, Dastan makes a desperate grab passing canvas awning. It RIPS -- but slows his flight as tears through a series of canvas awnings, one after anoth Dastan’s amazed he’s survived until... He runs out of awnings. Confronted with a FATAL DROP to t next rampart, he saves himself by grabbing the torn canva the last awning. On the rampart below, a trio of ARCHERS take aim. Dastan dangles in space, a prime target. Pushing off the stone wall with his feet, he struggles to climb the torn canvas. The first volley of arrows barely misses him. Dastan climbs faster. As he nears the top.. The canvas RIPS -- dropping him further than before and SLAMMING him into the wall. (Thanks to which, the second volley misses him too.) Dastan gets a new idea. He starts to “run” back and forth along the wall, swinging on the canvas to gain momentum. The cloth RIPS more. Not good. He’s hanging by a thread. His eye is on a nearby parapet: if he can swing to it...

Persian soldiers on the narrow bridge leading to the cita run a BATTERING RAM into the iron gate. Heave-ho! BAM! And again. BAM! The battering ram SMASHES through the gat The triumphant horde storms through the vaulted entrance- Only to find themselves confronted by a SECOND GATE! A TORRENT OF ARROWS is unleashed on them from above. They'r trapped by the men rushing in; it’s a slaughter.  10.

Running on the wall, Dastan swings almost within reach of parapet... just misses it. He swings back the other way; ARROW grazes him. Below him, two more ARCHERS join the firing squad. They l their bows. With determination, Dastan backs up as far as he can for final swing, the one that has to make it... As he’s swinging toward the parapet, his canvas “rope” BREAKS. Dastan sails through the air... Grabs for the parapet.. misses it.. plummets toward earth And, brilliantly, saves himself by grabbing a window ledg below. Scrambles through, just escaping a hail of ARROWS.

Dastan lands in a stone corridor. FIVE ALAMUT SOLDIERS converge on him. He draws his sword. And now we see Dastan fighting in his element. His style medieval Parkour; he uses walls, railings, statuary-- anything he can bounce, grab or roll off of for an advant Fighting him is like trying to grab hold of a bar of soap At one point, under double attack, Dastan reaches for his dagger-- only to find the sheath empty. Oh yeah, he gambl it away. CURSING, he ducks one blow while blocking anothe Dastan runs to the edge, looks down over the parapet. HIS POV: The main bridge below, clogged with soldiers. Beside him, thick rope cables rise from an open SHAFT.
Stop him! As the soldiers descend on him, Dastan jumps onto the mai CABLE and does a fireman’s slide to the platform below.  11.
Dastan lands; GUARDS rush him. He flips one, sends the ne plummeting down the shaft -- grabs a crank lever--
Dastan THROWS the lever, releasing the crank, which TURNS
A CHEER erupts from the horde of Persian soldiers as the RAISES. Men pour into the citadel.
TUS stares in disbelief as the bridge empties of men.
To the bridge! FROM ALL SIDES, soldiers pour onto the narrow bridge.
Tamina gazes out the window. A HANDMAID bursts in.
My Lady! We must flee! The invaders have breached the gate!
What? How did this happen?
There is no time-- you must save yourself!
There is far more at stake than my safety. The Handmaid bows her head in acknowledgment. Tamina rema calm and self-possessed.  12.
Send word to collapse the passages to the Hourglass. And have the dagger brought to me.
Yes my lady.

A courtyard of austere and exotic Eastern beauty. At the end stands a temple with a sacred FOUNTAIN guarded by sto lions -- all carved out of a massive block of pure white marble. A flood of Persian soldiers soon overwhelms the defenders
Civilians flee screaming through narrow stone streets.

The twins fight side by side without breaking a sweat. Nizam rides through the enemy troops wielding two swords once with a deadly dexterity surprising for a man his age Tus, hacking his way to victory, pauses --

Where’s Dastan? EXT. ANOTHER RAMPART —- DAY Dastan emerges onto a quiet rampart -- a narrow trench between two high walls. The battle has not yet reached th part of the castle. A FLASH OF LIGHT catches Dastan’s eye.. he looks up at an arched window where somebody is signalling with a small h mirror.. a fleeting glimpse of a beautiful female silhoue behind a sheer curtain: Tamina. Then.. HOOFBEATS. Dastan turns to see a mighty ALAMUT WARRIOR galloping toward him on an armored stallion.  13. Dastan’s trapped between the walls. The corridor is too narrow for him to escape. He’s about to be trampled. The WARRIOR draws a scimitar... At the last instant Dastan runs straight up the wall-- pu off with a backflip and lands ON THE HORSE! The two men GRAPPLE on horseback. Sparks fly as armor and weapons scrape the stone walls at full gallop. They fight -- Dastan getting the worst of it as his more heavily-armored opponent pounds him mercilessly. The Alam warrior raises his sword to finish Dastan once and for al Dastan throws his arms around the warrior’s waist, draggi him from the saddle. The two men crash to the ground. Dastan fights his way loose. Only then does he realize th the man he is struggling with is dead; an ARROW protrudes from his back. Dastan looks up to see Persian SOLDIERS running toward them.

The horse! Get the horse! The soldiers run greedily past Dastan after the riderless horse, leaving him alone with the fallen warrior. Dastan removes the warrior’s helmet. His face is noble an in agony; worse than the mortal wound is the shame of his failure... Dastan removes his breastplate to give him air TAMINA’S POV - from a window above she looks down and see Dastan kneeling over the body. The young warrior tries to speak-- Dastan cranes closer t hear his last words -- too late. He’s dead. Dastan slumps to a seated position, spent. We HEAR the victorious Persian soldiers looting the city in the dista Dastan notices a cloth-wrapped bundle tucked into the dea warrior’s waistband, under his armor. He pulls it out. Unwraps it. It’s a ceremonial DAGGER with a glass handle encrusted wi precious stones. Ancient and otherwordly, as if it had be made by the gods, not men.  14. The glass handle is half-filled with a fine white sand, s naturally bright it glows. Dastan tilts it curiously, the way you might tilt an hourglass. Glad to have it, Dastan sheathes the dagger in his own em scabbard... ON TAMINA - her eyes burn with fury as she watches. Dasta clothes are charred and torn from his escapades-- she tak him for the lowest sort of thief, one who loots the bodie the dead for easy plunder.
Dastan emerges and spots his brothers conferring with Niz amidst the crowd of soldiers. He approaches.
(to Tus) It stands to reason that their secret armories are well concealed. Why not leave a team behind here to search for them?
(spotting his brother) Dastan. Where have you been?
Tus, I opened the gate! Tus, in a bad mood, snaps--
Every man here played his part. Don’t take credit for their bravery. The Twins sneer and turn their back on Dastan, resuming t previous conversation...
(eager for booty) Nizam is right. Why don’t I stay and search for the armories?
Why not me?  15.
All of you -- return home. I myself shall conduct the search for these weapons that we came to find. The steel in his tone warns them all not to argue further
(bows deeply) We hear and obey, my prince.

An OFFICER inspects a group of captive YOUNG WOMEN the soldiers have brought in. Among them is Tamina, her fine white dress concealed under a drab cloak. Tamina evades the Officer’s gaze; he lifts her chin to ge good look at her face.

Let’s see your hands. Tamina shows one hand. The Officer yanks the other into view, then gives her a rough whole-body frisk. Tamina suppresses her shame and anger as he moves on the to next girl. REVEAL: Tamina’s palmed the ornate RING she was wearing earlier. She slips it unnoticed into the folds of her clo Across the courtyard she spots Dastan. Her eyes burn into him, and especially into the DAGGER in his belt..
A caravan of Persian SOLDIERS, HORSES and CAMELS wends it way down from the forbidding, icy mountain peaks. Dastan sits backward in his saddle, reading a book. Nizam rides up alongside.
Your brothers do you an injustice. You turned the battle.
I don’t need their praise. Nizam smiles.  16.
You have much to learn about the ways of politics, Dastan. Praise, flattery, renown -- these are the currency of power in court. Nizam gestures toward a row of carts laden with booty.
Look, your brothers bring your father treasures, trophies of war. What have you brought to gain his favor?
I’d rather earn his favor honestly.
How so? Dastan puts away his book and turns around in the saddle.

Nizam, why do we win victories? Because we have the greatest army. The army he built, with his life’s blood, starting from nothing. That was an accomplishment. What have I done thus far except go along for the ride?
To be the son of a great king-- even a fourth son-- is a destiny most men would envy.

Do you know what I want? To set forth from home with no army, just one horse and a good sword, and no one knowing I am the son of Shahraman. Then my achievements may be small-- but they’1l be mine. And I can bring them home to him with pride.
(with a twinkle) Dastan, I have misjudged you. I thought you the most modest of my King’s sons. In fact, you are the most ambitious.  17.
I’m not joking, Nizam. I will do it. As soon as we arrive, I’1l ask my father for his blessing.
You'd do well to bring a gift.
Perhaps you’re right. If only I’d asked for a share of the loot... Dastan casts a glance at one of the CARTS piled high with rich silks, tapestries and gold...
Do you think Tus would mind..?

Well... you did open the gate. Nizam winks at him and spurs his horse onward. Dastan, alone for the moment, trots his horse close to a cart. He scans the treasures and selects a gorgeous, embroidered silk ROBE as a gift.

The sun sets behind the gleaming spires and domes of the royal city of NASAF. TILT DOWN to REVEAL the dusty carava finally arriving home. The returning soldiers are met by a cheering crowd. The Captain of the Guards, GARSIV (a young hotshot) stand attention for the returning nobles. His expression sours when Dastan comes abreast of him: the two are about the s age, and clearly have some history.
No injuries, Dastan? Didn’t your brothers let you fight?
Hardly at all, Garsiv. I’m very rusty; maybe you’ll be able to beat me in the tournament this year. Finally. Dastan smiles tauntingly and rides past.  18.

A magnificent eighth century palace with high vaulted ceilings and tiled mosaics. Musicians play flutes and tambourines, beautiful slaves circulate, serving delicacies to the guests (all male), seated on cushions at low tables.

Is part of a group of newbie SLAVE GIRLS being prepped by stern MATRON who makes last minute adjustments to each gi attire before sending her out with an hors d’oeuvre tray. The Matron frowns at Tamina’s outfit, tugs at it to revea more cleavage. Tamina, indignant, seems about to slap her then remembering where she is, submits. Her face burns as the Matron sends her forth with a pat on the ass. FOLLOW the slave girls as they mix into the crowd... and PAST them, to a roped-off royal dais where...
Tears into a chicken leg with gusto. The Twins, eating wi elegant delicacy shoot him twin looks of disgust.
You eat like a common foot-soldier.

Foot-soldiers know how to enjoy a good meal when they get one. Bismillah. Dastan halts mid-bite as he sees... TAMINA across the room. He is mesmerized by the sight of her. He drops his chicken and starts toward her..
As she struggles under the weight of the tray. It is unexpectedly lifted from her hands by:

Allow me.. a delicate flower such as yourself needs care and drink, not heavy labor.  19. With a flourish, he swings the tray to a nearby table, co up with two goblets of wine and offers one to her... Her eyes go wide with recognition; he interprets her reac as fear of being caught by the Matron.
Have no fear. I’m Prince Dastan and I hereby grant you a temporary reprieve from your duties.
I have seen you before, you son of a dog. You steal from the dead. I curse your eyes. Dastan laughs modestly, not comprehending a word.

No, please-- there’s no need to thank me, Slave-Girl. You will find I’m a very modern thinker. Social rank means nothing to me.. As Dastan babbles on, trying to impress Tamina, her eyes to the hilt of the DAGGER in his belt...

SO you needn’t be intimidated by the fact that I’m a prince. Although I’m sure it sounds very impressive to you, I’m only a fourth son-- A FANFARE of TRUMPETS signals the start of the royal procession. Everybody surges forward to look; Dastan and Tamina are separated in the crowd...
As the Matron catches her without a tray and sends her roughly back to the kitchen.
Tamina ducks out of the line of slaves and doubles back toward the banquet hall.

Tamina finds herself alone in a dark hallway.  20. A sliver of light spills out of a door that is ajar. She hesitates and peeks inside... She stares: whatever she sees is definitely something she wasn’t supposed to.
What are you doing here? Somebody grab that girl! Tamina flees. She races down the hall and slips into a laundry room to hide...

KING SHAHRAMAN enters with his entourage. Gray-bearded in silk robes, he’s the aged ruin of a once-powerful warrior All bow deeply as he passes. AT THE DIAS everyone gathers and takes his place.. Garsiv, Captain of the Guards stands sentry behind the throne. Nizam steps to the fore ahead of the princes.
(embracing Nizam) Nizam, my old friend! Again your wisdom has brought us victory.
Not my wisdom. By your royal faar your sons have brought honor and glory to the banner of Nasaf.
(suddenly perturbed) Where is my eldest son?

Tus has remained to bring order to the lands conquered in your name. His brothers will convey his greetings to you. The Twins step forward with elaborately ceremonial, simultaneous bows -- a bit over the top for Shahraman.  21.
My lord and father, to see you is like seeing the sun after the longest night of winter. Our noble brother has entrusted me--
Us.
--has entrusted us with gifts. On cue, TEN SLAVES enter bearing ten gold platters laden jewels, their powerful muscles straining under the weight
And I bring gifts as well.
We.
We bring gifts. Twenty more slaves parade in, bearing twenty golden platt piled even higher than the first.
From Turan and Alamut, out of love for you, we carried the treasure--
--his as well as ours--
Alamut?
--through treacherous mountains, across the burning desert, and--
The Twins quake; did they say something wrong? Dastan is confused as they are. Nizam steps forward.
What are these babbling fools saying? Did we conquer Alamut?  22.
We did, sire.
The kingdom of Alamut has endured inviolate for centuries as a sacred city. Why did Tus order the attack?

O King, your son was provoked by the treachery of Alamut.. when you learn the full truth, you will understand. But look, your youngest son waits to greet you. Shahraman looks at Dastan; his anger melts away. He has a special fondness for this son. Dastan throws himself into his dad's embrace, hugs him hard.
Dastan. What mischief have you been up to?
Father, I’ve brought you a gift.

(affectionately) Do you mean to say you haven’t lost it or gambled it away? Dastan beckons to a pretty FEMALE SLAVE who appears carry a cloth bundle -- and in a nifty move, shakes it out, unveiling the ROBE OF HONOR. Everyone oohs. Shahraman takes the robe. Runs his fingers over the gold- embroidered silk. He’s genuinely surprised and touched.
Dastan, this is unlike you. I shall wear it with pride. Attendants remove Shahraman’s robe and help him don the n one. The Twins seethe with jealousy at such favoritism.
(the perfect moment) Father, I wish to speak with you about a very important matter...  23.
Later, my son. Shahraman mounts the dais and seats himself on the throne
Now Nizam, tell me of Alamut.
O King, we discovered information that Alamut was secretly supporting -- My King, is something wrong? The new robe seems to itch Shahraman; he tugs at it irritably.
It’s hot. Get to the point.
We learned from a captured Turanian warrior that...
Father?
Take off the robe! Attendants hasten to remove the robe, but cannot. It won’ come off-- it’s glued to his skin. Shahraman ROARS in pai
Father! ! Shahraman lurches to his feet. Like a maddened bull, he shakes off his attendants, tearing at the robe. STEAM his from the burning places where it STICKS to his flesh.
It’s poisoned!

Take it off! Every one is shocked and horrified. Dastan hurtles to his father’s side. Catches him as he falls, staining his own clothes with blood. Shahraman is dying in agony, with thi degree burns all over his body.
wiy son?  24. Garsiv rushes to help his king. He shoves Dastan aside.
You’ve killed your father!
What? No! I--
(shouts ) Prince Dastan has killed the king! Guards rip Dastan away from Shahraman. While he struggles Garsiv and other guards attempt to remove the King’s robe but only intensify his death agony.
(fighting to break free)
Garsiv lowers Shahraman’s dead body to the ground. He dra his sword and points it at Dastan.
Murderer! The Twins draw their swords as well. All eyes are on Dast
(choking back tears) I didn’t do this! (looks around desperately) Nizam! Tell them... Nizam looks at him with shocked disappointment.

That is for a tribunal to decide, Dastan. He nods sadly to the guards; they drag Dastan from the ro With a sudden, desperate burst of strength, Dastan breaks free. He snatches a sword from one of the guards, parries the attack of another and... «escapes through a small doorway behind the dais.  25.
Dastan runs for his life. Footsteps and shouts behind him He ducks into...
Dastan slams the door shut behind him. He turns and sees.
She stands by the window, holding a rope made of knotted sheets. Obviously preparing her own escape.
Slave-Girl! What strange good fortune-- BAM! BAM! Soldiers are at the door. She pushes him to the window.
Go!
Dastan lands with a thud at the bottom of the sheet-rope. Tamina tumbles down on top of him just as he tries to get Tamina leaps to her feet. Dastan is slower getting up.
Thank you for your help, Slave- Girl. Now hide yourself. I must flee at once and doubtless you cannot even-- Tamina mounts a magnificent Arabian THOROUGHBRED and take off at a gallop.
tide. Dastan stares for a moment. Then the GUARDS burst out of doorway. Dastan leaps onto the nearest available mount-- humiliatingly small and unimpressive pony-- and spurs it

A dozen of the King’s HORSEMEN led by Garsiv ride out, trapping Tamina and Dastan. They’re the best-trained, most formidable military unit i Persia. Normally everyone flees from them. Instead, Dasta rides straight at them. He dodges right -- then left -- and slips by: Magic Johns on horseback. The resulting moment of disarray lets Tamin charge past on the other side and out the entrance.
Close the gate! As the GUARDS relay Garsiv’s command like an echo, the do horsemen turn around as one to give chase.

The two fugitives gallop toward the great, lowering iron gate, Garsiv’s posse on their heels. Tamina’s larger and faster horse gets there first. Dastan catches a glimpse of her nimbly swinging sideways in her saddle to avoid decapitation as she rides under the closi gate. Impressive. But it looks like the gate will close before Dastan gets there. To make matters worse, four FOOTSOLDIE range out in front of it, with spears raised to impale hi Dastan’s eyes narrow. Redoubling his speed, he charges on and SHATTERS a spear with his sword, opening space to pas He swings halfway off his horse and narrowly squeezes through. The gate closes, sealing in Garsiv’s men.
Open the gate!! The soldiers raise the gate they just closed. Garsiv’s posse, which has swelled to forty riders, charges through

Dastan and Tamina gallop out of the walled city and strik out toward the hills with the king’s men in pursuit. A full moon illuminates the rough terrain. Tamina leads t way over a series of increasingly treacherous jumps.  27.

(amazed) Where did you learn to ride so well, Slave-Girl? Two pursuing horsemen fall jumping the boulders. The othe press closer... An ARROW whistles past Dastan’s head. He looks over his shoulder, sees the posse gaining on him. He urges the lit horse to greater speed but he’s outclassed. Inexorably, the first ARCHER draws even with Dastan.
