Do you see that black paving-stone? Dastan looks closely; he can make out a few flakes of wha might have been black paint, a thousand years ago.
I wouldn’t call it black. Maybe it’s a little bit darker than the others.
We’re in the sun god’s temple. The black stones represent man’s wickedness, the greed and selfishness that brought the sandstorm on us. We don’t step on the black stones.
All right, look. I don’t want to disrespect your religion. It’s just that we may not have time to follow every little superstition...
Dastan! Her eyes flash dangerously. Dastan backs down.
All right. No black stones.
Nizam turns from the dig as Garsiv strides to meet him.
My lord. Dastan is in Alamut.

Tamina and Dastan come to a halt at the edge of a water- filled chasm where a rope bridge used to be. Remnants of rope dangle uselessly from either side. The rock wall has partially collapsed, smashing the bridge and flooding the chasm with water.  84.
(dismayed) They must have weakened that wall with their digging. Now we can’t get across. Dastan’s eyes rove the far wall.
I think I can.
How? Dastan backs up for a running start. Tamina grabs him.
Don’t be a fool. You can’t jump that far.

I know that. I’m not crazy. He sprints toward the edge... but instead of jumping the he RUNS ALONG THE WALL for a good 20 feet.. until gravity catches up with him, his feet slip-slide and he starts to fall. Dastan PUSHES OFF THE WALL with his feet, propelling hims across the gap -- GRABS a crevice in the rock wall opposi barely saving himself from the plunge -- -- as SPIKES spring up below, breaking the surface of the muddy water covering the bottom of the pit. Tamina gasps. Dastan begins to rock-climb across the wall, using the mo miniscule hand and footholds. He nearly falls -- more spi spring up below -- but he hangs on, keeps going. Tamina watches, holding her breath. At last Dastan reaches the far wall. It’s sheer, not a handhold in sight. He gropes for one anyway. His hand SLI on the slick rock. Tamina can’t look... The chasm is too wide at this end for Dastan to jump back the opposite wall. Nevertheless, he braces his feet again the rock -- and LAUNCHES himself out into space.  85. Sailing over the pit.. he GRABS the end of the broken rop bridge as he falls past it. Hangs on, twisting and dangli It holds. Dastan climbs up the rope bridge to safety. Brushes himse off, shouts reproachfully at Tamina across the chasm--
You could have warned me about the spikes!
How do I get across? Dastan looks around. There’s no way.
We'll figure something out.

No. You’re almost there. (she takes out the dagger) In the top of the hourglass is all time yet to come. In the bottom is time past. Between the two, it narrows to the width of a single moment: the Now. That is where you must insert the dagger’s handle. She tosses the dagger across the chasm. Dastan catches it

Hold the dagger by the blade. The handle will catch the sand as it falls. This is important: the blade must never touch the hourglass. Their eyes meet across the chasm. Both acknowledging the trust she’s placed in him.
Just make sure you’re here when I get back. He disappears. Tamina watches him go.
Watch out for the black stones!  86.

Dastan threads his way through a narrow corridor, steppin over the occasional black tile. With each step he takes, nothing happens and he grows more confident. He comes to another stone LION like the first. Sighing, h does as Tamina did, placing his back against the opposite wall.

Lion, I cannot bow down before you for no one deserves worship but God. But I do respect you, as a lion -- and I ask you not to bite me. Pleased with this compromise, Dastan passes the lion. And catches himself just about to step on a faded, black- painted stone. Looking ahead he realizes that half the paving stones in corridor ahead of him are black.

(sighs) God forgive me -- but she believes in it so what am I to do? With a martyred air, he hop-scotches down the corridor, f one safe stone to the next, until he reaches the alcove a the passageway’s midpoint. As he pauses to take a breather, Dastan’s eye is drawn to MURAL depicting the LEGEND: an angry sun god with a lion’ head, a blinding sandstorm, the hourglass... Dastan gazes in awe, experiencing the full religious impa Maybe there’s more to this than he thought... Dastan takes a deep breath and looks ahead; the second ha of the passageway is filled with even more black stones. Carefully, he hops between the increasingly scarce safe stones. To avoid getting stranded, he’s forced to start using the walls, clinging to them like a rockclimber. At last, the end of the black tiles comes into sight. Gritting his teeth, he PUSHES off the wall with his feet, JUMPS through the air, straining for distance--  87. He’s not going to make it. Switching his landing to a div at the last instant, he hits the floor with both hands instead of his feet, tumbles-- and clears it! Exhaling with relief, he gets to his feet... And hears an ominous “snick” he’s never heard before. Looking down he sees he’s standing right on a BLACK STONE He looks around for bad consequences. Doesn’t see any.

Sorry lion. THWIPP!! A SCYTHE comes swinging down from the ceiling behind him. Dastan jumps ASIDE, barely escaping being bisected vertically -- only to land on another black ston FWIPP! A HORIZONTAL SCYTHE whips out from the wall at kne level. The blade just misses him as he JUMPS BACK -- Triggering TWO MORE HORIZONTAL SCYTHES on the opposite wa one at neck level, one waist-high. He escapes both by

-- Lands face down, only to hear the telltale “snick” of weight depressing yet another black stone. Uh-oh... Dastan ROLLS out of the way of one VERTICAL SCYTHE that w out of the floor -- lifts his legs just in time to escape castration by ANOTHER -- and SOMERSAULTS past a third. He lands in a crouch, looking around in wild terror. Miraculously, he’s survived it all.

(very fast, heartfelt) There is no god but God, the Almighty, all-compassionate and all- merciful. Praise be to God; You alone do we worship; Guide us on the straight path; Amen. (quick afterthought) And no disrespect to the Lion.

Dastan advances into the silent, natural cavern. A waterfall cascades down a sheer rock face into the dark of an abyss. We HEAR an underground river rushing far bel  88. Towering at the edge of the abyss is a titanic HOURGLASS. seems to have grown out of the rock itself. It holds thousands of tons of glowing white sand that bathe the chamber in an eerie light. Fascinated, Dastan approaches. He stares at the sand; thousands of millions of years worth of time -- no way to fathom it. He looks up at an ascending set of stairs carved into the stone, leading to a rock promontory at the neck of the hourglass... He begins to climb the stairs. At the top is a flat outcropping of rock. Above him looms the gigantic upper h of the hourglass, a vast reservoir of glowing sand. Dastan lies down and belly crawls until his head and shoulders are over the edge of the abyss and he can reach neck of the hourglass. He draws the dagger. Holding it as Tamina instructed, by blade, he brings its handle to within an inch of the glas

God is great. Bismillah. He pushes the dagger forward, with no idea what will happ The dagger’s handle penetrates the thick glass, instantly rendered liquid as quicksilver. Dastan’s so startled he jerks it right back out again -- rendering the glass once more miraculously intact. Deliberately, Dastan repeats the action. This time, he ho the dagger inside the hourglass, to catch the falling san Slowly, before his eyes, the glass handle starts to fill.

A pick-axe breaks through the rock shelf, triggering a landslide beneath the diggers’ feet. With SHOUTS of alarm they slide toward the bottom; their fellow diggers catch them, hanging on for dear life, and pull them to safety.  89.

Tamina is startled to see new CRACKS suddenly appear in t rock wall above the chasm. WATER trickles through, suggesting a significant pressure build-up on the other s Tamina backs away... The water BURSTS part of the wall, pours through in a torrent.
Dastan realizes he’s been holding his breath. With a gasp he pulls the dagger back. It’s full of glowing sand. The hourglass is as solid as if it had never been touched

Dastan hop-scothes back through the corridor, nimbly avoi the black stones. Until, hurrying past the stone lion, he forgets to hug th opposite wall. Serrated IRON JAWS swing out from the horizontal slit of the lion’s mouth. Dastan hurdles over jaws as they crunch together like a giant bear-trap. As Dastan runs, the corridor floor COLLAPSES under him. Desperately he increases his speed. He can already see th broken bridge ahead. In a few more strides, there’1ll be floor left to run on. He makes a heroic RUNNING JUMP-- «out into space, above the yawning chasm where the floor in... «And falls short. He can’t believe it. After everything h been through, this is how it ends -- plunging toward cert death on JAGGED SPIKES below! As he’s about to be impaled, he snatches the dagger from sheath -- BOOM!! TIME STOPS -- the spikes inches from Dastan’s ches the entire scene frozen except for the SAND spilling from dagger in Dastan’s hand... his finger on the jewel. The s blows away like ash in the wind.

TIME RUNS BACKWARD. Dastan flies up away from the spikes, the corridor floor reassembling under his feet as he runs backwards, JUMPS backward over the lion-jaws as they open Until his hand releases the jewel.
This time, Dastan runs to one side as he passes the lion jaws. And he’s through, safely skirting all the traps.
WATER GUSHES IN, swelling the already flooded pit.. while cracks pop up everywhere in the stressed rock wall. Tamin sees Dastan appear on the far side of the chasm.

It’s collapsing! Dastan surveys the scene. He sees that the rock wall is a DAM ready to BURST-- Suddenly the edge where Tamina is standing COLLAPSES! She falls into the water. Without hesitation, Dastan dives into the chasm and start swimming across, dodging falling rocks and swirling curre Tamina sees Dastan go under.. she looks around desperatel Dastan surfaces right in front of her.

Take a deep breath. He grabs Tamina and pulls her down into the water. THE DAM BURSTS! The wall caves in, a THUNDER OF ROCK and WATER are unleashed. UNDERWATER: The explosive current propels Dastan and Tami through a stone-walled channel -- Dastan takes Tamina’s h kicks upward toward the LIGHT --  91.
Dastan and Tamina surface in the river, below the citadel wall. They gasp for air. As soon as they catch their breath...
You used the dagger, didn’t you! Battered, half-dead with exhaustion, Dastan hoists himsel onto the embankment. He reaches to help Tamina up. Angril she shakes him off.
One minute. We have one minute of sand to get to your brother and you've already used half of it! Dastan looks at the dagger -- it’s half empty.
I didn’t think I used that much. Just then, he dodges instinctively as an ARROW misses his head by inches, imbeds in the wall behind him. Defensivel before Tamina can accuse him--
It missed by itself. ARCHERS assemble on the ramparts above. Dastan and Tamina race up the stone steps of the embankment.
I just had the strangest feeling we've done this before... Dastan suddenly grabs her, yanks her back.
What?
Wait. In the next instant, a volley of ARROWS shoot past right front of Tamina. Dastan releases her.
Now.  92. As they continue their dash up the stairs--
You did it again, didn’t you!?
That time I did. Trust me, you weren’t any happier the other way.

The majestic hourglass sits in silent darkness. Suddenly, a PICK breaks through the roof. A shaft of sunlight illuminates the chamber that has been dark for centuries. Shouts of excitement from the workers above. More picks c at the hole, raining down rocks and debris. THE HOURGLASS: as the rocks strike its surface, it begins resonate like a great warning bell... EXT. EXCAVATION PIT —- SAME Drawn by the sound, Nizam moves down toward the hole.. hi eyes light up as he finally glimpses the prize below.
Magnificent... (turns to a FOREMAN) Have them search every chamber. When they find a dagger with a clear handle, have it brought directly to me.
Tamina takes Dastan’s arm, points to the ROYAL PALACE standing on the other side of a deep mountain gorge. A narrow stone bridge below is the only way across the chas
That’s the palace just across that bridge. I know a place-- Dastan tackles her to the ground as a SPEAR hurtles throu the space where they were just standing.  93.

(not without pride) God, our soldiers are good! Tamina looks, sees-— A DOZEN SOLDIERS running toward them across the rooftops. More on their way, throwing up ladders as they climb. Dastan yanks Tamina to her feet. With the army on their heels, they improvise a rapid descent via stairs, ladders free-fall to the bridge level. As they climb down the final ladder (Tamina first), more soldiers run toward them from the bridge. Dastan and Tami are trapped between the new arrivals and the soldiers abo Dastan reaches for the DAGGER. Tamina stops him.

No. Dastan grits his teeth. All right, he’1l do it the hard w He PUSHES OFF the wall with the ladder, LANDS in a judo r that FLIPS the ladder over him-- tossing Tamina over the heads of the soldiers in front of them. Dastan continues momentum, POLE-VAULTING over Tamina on the ladder. This master-stroke puts all the soldiers behind them, leaving a clear path to the bridge.
Run.

Dastan and Tamina make a mad dash across the bridge. They more than halfway there when MORE SOLDIERS appear on the side, led by Garsiv. Dastan comes to a skidding stop. He looks back: they’re trapped on a long, narrow stone bridge between two armies, above a vertigo-inducing ravin plunging ten thousand feet below.

Should have used the dagger. With a communal ROAR, the soldiers charge from both sides Dastan swings into action. Snatching up a rope coil, he swiftly ties it around a parapet of the bridge wall...  94. «and draws his sword as the soldiers descend on them. Hopelessly outnumbered, Dastan and Tamina leap onto the bridge wall and run BACK the way they came-- Dastan parry sword blows and uncoiling rope as he runs.
You can’t possibly--
Hold tight. Tamina locks her arms around Dastan just in time -- he JU

head_text.subj: THEY PLUMMET ON THE ROPE TOWARDS THE BOTTOMLESS GORGE

text: The rope stops their fall; they start swinging back towar the far side of the bridge-- incredibly, straight for a t ARCHER'S LOOPHOLE in the sheer fortress wall opposite. Dastan’s aim was brilliant. But not perfect. They slam into the wall below the loophole. It’s just out their reach. As they start swinging back--

Climb higher! We’1ll make it on the next swing! Tamina and Dastan desperately climb up a few feet on the rope. ARCHERS on the bridge above them unleash a volley o arrows, which miss, but don’t make their task any easier. They reach the apex of their backswing, begin their retur toward the loophole.. Dastan reaches out to grab it-- Only this time, they don’t even reach the wall. They’ve l too much momentum.
Dastan and Tamina swing uselessly back and forth, in a smaller arc each time. They’re trapped at the end of the rope. Hanging off a bridge that’s full of soldiers. Oops.

A soldier (call him the EXECUTIONER) mounts the parapet w Dastan tied the rope. He draws a wicked scimitar. Checks with Garsiv, who nods: do it. The Executioner raises his sword high-- and CHOPS! DASTAN and TAMINA are shaken. One more cut will sever the rope.
All right. Use the dagger.
Oh I don’t know, I think we can get out of this one.

Use the dagger! NOW!! The Executioner raises his scimitar for the coup de grace Dastan releases one hand from the rope, uses it to pull Tamina toward him and gives her a passionate kiss. The sword cuts the rope: Dastan and Tamina plunge into th abyss... then Dastan HITS the jewel.
Reversing through the kiss, and all their back-and-forth swings, wider each time, until they land back up on--

Hold tight. Exactly as before, Tamina locks her arms around Dastan as JUMPS from the parapet. Only this time, he adjusts his aim, hastily CLIMBING the as they swing.. hits the loophole, grabs and pulls them i
Garsiv stares down into the gorge, dumbfounded, at the em rope swinging below the bridge. They’ve escaped him.  96.
Tamina and Dastan land together on the floor.
That was fantastic! Dastan sits up and stares at her with a goofy grin, still mesmerized from their kiss...
Dastan! Did you use the dagger?
What? No! Of course not... She examines his face but he doesn’t break. No time for further discussion. She sets off down the hall and he hurries after her.
They race up stairs, through corridors, etc. Soldiers’ voices echo, seemingly around every corner, but they see nobody.

I hope you know where you’re going. Tamina throws open the small wooden door of a supply clos they duck inside. She closes the door, plunging them into darkness. WE HEAR their breathing, rapid and shallow.. then the cli a hidden latch and another door swings open--
Tamina lights a lantern revealing a cozy room, rich with curtains and draperies, a tea service and silk cushions.
A secret getaway...?

For the king. I was a nosy little girl, always getting into places I wasn’t supposed to...  97. She parts a curtain, revealing a short passageway that de ends in a door. Tamina slides open a peephole and looks..
Servants fill the royal baths with hot water. Tamina step aside to let Dastan look.

The King’s private bath. They’re preparing it for him now. When your brother returns, you’ll have a chance to speak to him alone. She walks back into the secret room. Dastan follows. He opens the shutter to look out the small window... On the stone bridge far below he sees dozens of soldiers running around searching for the escaped fugitives. Dastan turns to see Tamina step out from behind a folding screen, having changed into a gorgeous silk gown. He stares, stunned. Tamina looks down.
What? You don’t like it? I had to get out of those rags...

No, no, I like it.. it’s just... you look beautiful. He takes a step closer. Her face bathed in the warm light exquisite.. her skin flawless.. he looks into her dark ey and.. kisses her full on the mouth. Except this time there is no rewind. He catches himself, waiting for her to slap him. but instead, Tamina responds She kisses him deeply in return, giving into the moment, pressing against him. their pent-up attraction is release and their embrace becomes more and more passionate until- Tamina suddenly pulls away.
Stop. This can never be.
What? What can never be?  98.
Us. You and me.

Why not? I mean, assuming I convince my brother, restore your kingdom and all that stuff... why not? (suddenly defensive) It’s because I’m only a fourth son, isn’t it? She shakes her head sadly and looks toward the window.
I don’t care about that. It’s because I’m the High Priestess. I can only marry one who has been baptized in the sacred fountain.
Is that all? I told you I’m a very modern thinker; if it’s that important to you I’1l take a dip--
You can’t! Nobody can, ever again. The fountain has been destroyed. A beat. Tamina looks at him wistfully.

I’m sorry, Dastan. It’s not meant to be between us. Dastan searches for the right words to say when... A HORN BLAST outside signals the king’s arrival. They bot hurry to the window in time to see: TUS and a half-dozen GUARDS ride across the bridge.
My brother.
You'd best prepare yourself. You cannot fail.  99.
Tus and his bodyguards stride across the great hall. A YO GUARD steps forward and bows.
My King. Nizam sends word that he would speak with you.
I’ve been riding all day. I’11 see him after I’ve bathed and changed.
STEAM fills the room. The King’s guards watch the ATTENDA prepare the bath in a centuries-old Eastern ritual.
Dastan watches through the peephole, rehearsing nervously under his breath.

‘It was not I who killed our father.’ Can’t start with that. ‘My brother, it is I, Dastan. I come to you in peace...’ No time for that; get to the point! ‘My brother...’ That’s a good start. DASTAN’S POV - the guards escort the attendants out. Mome later, Tus enters. The guards leave him alone to his bath
‘My brother...’ ‘My noble brother...’ Dastan turns and locks eyes with Tamina one last time; sh gives him an encouraging nod.. Dastan presses on the door

The secret door, invisible in the tiled wall, opens. Dast steps through silently and disappears into the steam. TUS takes off his robe and lowers himself into the steami water. Rinses his face and hair and sinks down. He closes his eyes... Suddenly he feels a draft. Frowns. Opens his eyes...  100.
My noble brother. Tus splashes to his feet, waist-high in the water.
No!
Dastan throws his sword aside. Holds up his hands-- unarm
You have nothing to fear from me. What Nizam told you is a lie. He killed Father. It was Nizam who poisoned the robe. The GUARDS burst in and seize Dastan
Tus, Nizam deceived us all. He made us conquer Alamut so he could possess its secrets! And if you try to stop him, he will kill you too!
Enough! ! Everyone falls silent. Dastan ceases struggling and waits suspense for Tus’s next words.

We are brothers. Since childhood I’ve known you as I know myself. I can tell by how artfully you’ve rehearsed your speech that you are lying. (to the guards) Take him to Nizam. ANGLE ON TAMINA - watching through the peephole, dismayed Tus turns away as the guards drag Dastan off.  101.
No! Tus, listen to me, I’m not making this up! TUS!! Tus never looks back. Dastan appeals to the guards:
I beg you. One minute. Let me speak to him. As you love him, as you loved your king-- The CAPTAIN of the guards punches him in the head.
Shut up, you. Now Dastan’s mad. With a herculean effort, he yanks free, just enough to draw the dagger from his belt--
He’s got a knife. --and hits the JEWEL. BOOM!! TIME STANDS STILL.

Tus takes off his robe, lowers himself into the steaming bath. Rinses his face and hair, just as he did before. A NOISE makes Tus turn. Dastan has just BARRICADED the do with a medieval two-by-four. Tus splashes to his feet. Th time, the first thing Dastan does is throw his sword away
Tus, don’t call the guards yet. Listen to me.
Dastan winces; continues, improvising...
Beneath this citadel is an ancient, mystical force beyond anything you can imagine. It’s the hourglass that contains the Sands of Time. SOUNDS of the guards beating at the barricaded door--  102.
This dagger holds only a minute’s worth of the sand. He draws the dagger, forgetting it’s a weapon too--
Coward! Do you attack me thus, unarmed?
No! Hastily turning the dagger around-- this isn’t going well

Nizam is after the hourglass and the dagger. He tricked us into falsely invading a kingdom that has done us no wrong. To hide his lies, he murdered our father and threw the blame on me. The door gives way; the guards burst in. Dastan doesn’t h to wait for Tus’s verdict to know he’s blown it.
(angry with himself) Damn it! He jumps back, using the dagger to hold the guards at bay
Stand back! I warn you! The guards hesitate, perplexed. In a second they'll reali there’s no real threat and rush him.
I need a minute. Just give me a minute to think. He looks at the dagger in his hand -- nearly empty. Just enough sand for one last rewind. Suddenly, desperately, he looks at Tus. He knows what to
Tus, this is no ordinary dagger. Touch this jewel on its handle and you will learn Alamut’s greatest secret.  103.
(to the guards) Enough! Take him to Nizam. As the guards move forward, Dastan swiftly brings the dagger’s blade to his own throat. Again, they hesitate.

(to Tus) If you won’t believe me, then our kingdom is forfeit. Our honor is forfeit. And I’m better off dead. Dastan PLUNGES the dagger into his own heart. Under the astonished stares of the guards, he crumples to his knees Blood appears on his lips. He falls dead. ON TAMINA - who stifles a cry. Tus shakes off the guard who’s just helped him put on his robe. He advances toward his brother’s body.

My lord, if it’s a trick... Tus turns Dastan over. He’s dead, the hilt of the dagger protruding from his chest. Tus pulls it out. The blade is wet with blood. Tus examines the dagger. The unearthly, glowing white san inside its handle. For a moment we think he’s going to do something with it-- but he just lays the dagger back down the floor.
(to one of his men) Get Nizam. ON TAMINA - who pulls away from the peephole, tears strea down her face. She can’t look. The Captain tries to escort Tus out of the baths, but Tus lingers, troubled.
He took his own life.
A coward’s way out.

My brother was no coward.  104. He bends and picks up the dagger again. Presses the jewel TIME STOPS! The last sands fall from the dagger; a draft blows them away through the steam frozen in midair...

The guards close in on Dastan, just as they did before. T whirls, bewildered by deja vu: what’s happening here? As he did before, Dastan dramatically holds the dagger to own throat -- unaware that the final rewind has already happened and that the dagger is empty.

If you won’t believe me, then our kingdom is forfeit. Our honor is forfeit. And I’m better off dead. Tus lunges at Dastan, GRABS his arm just in time to preve him from stabbing himself. The guards pull them apart.
Let him go!! Cowed by the royal command in his voice, the guards obey.
Thanks brother.
(wonderment ) You were dead. I saw the blood.
Blood? What blood? Perplexed, he looks down at the dagger in his hand. He nearly faints on seeing that it’s empty. Tus, overcome by emotion, clasps Dastan in a warm embrace.

My brother. On the day we left for war, our father told me: ‘A king should listen always to the voice of reason-- but also listen to your heart.’ My heart knew you could not have done what they accused you of. I should have listened.  105. Dastan nods, still a bit shaky.
(to the CAPTAIN) Send for a detachment of soldiers from my most trusted regiment. The Captain nods and exits. Tus turns back to Dastan.
Come. We must find Nizam.

One more thing, brother. There is somebody I want you to meet... Dastan turns toward the secret door as... TAMINA emerges like a vision from the steam. Tus looks at his younger brother, impressed: where’d you her?
It’s a long story.

Thunder rumbles in an ominous sky. Tus, Dastan and Tamina stride across the bridge accompanied by royal GUARDS with torches. Nizam appears at the end of the bridge with his own detachment of elite GUARDS led by Garsiv.
Keep your swords sheathed. As the two groups come together, Nizam speaks first.
O King!

Grand Vizier Nizam, you have committed treason and murder and have conspired against the house of Shahraman. (to Garsiv) Captain of the Guards, I order you to arrest this traitor.  106. Garsiv steps forward and looks Nizam in the eye.. then he turns and nods to the GUARDS surrounding Tus... Tus’s own guards grab him, Dastan and Tamina, bind their hands behind their backs and force them to their knees!
Who dares lay a hand on Tus, son of Shahraman, your King!
O King, O Prince, I am the shadow of the reflection of your greatness. Your humble servant... As Nizam bows mockingly, Garsiv plucks Dastan’s sword fro him and raises it high...

Garsiv brings the sword slashing down. We don’t see the impact, only the men’s reactions. Tus lies dead on the stone bridge, a spreading pool of bl beneath him in the light rain. Garsiv throws the sword down. It clatters next to Dastan.
Your sword... A CLATTERING OF HOOVES signals the arrival of the detachm of trusted soldiers with the CAPTAIN sent to fetch them.
Ho! Help! Murder!! Dastan opens his mouth to protest but the guards silence with a rain of kicks and blows. As the SOLDIERS arrive on the scene, Nizam steps forward in apparent anguish.
God help us! We arrived too late. Our King is dead-- slain by Dastan, who killed his father. Dastan tries to speak but the guards redouble their blows
He’s lying! Dastan is innocent!  107.

This is the daughter of our enemy! He would have conspired with her to lead the people of this city against us! An angry murmur rises from among the detachment of soldie eager for revenge on their king’s murderer.

(steps in) I shall take charge of questioning Dastan and his accomplice. I will find out the full extent of this conspiracy. Nizam’s guards hustle Tamina and Dastan along the bridge, drowning their protests... leaving the Captain and the so staring mournfully down at Tus’s body in the rain.
Tamina and Dastan are shoved into a cell and chained to t wall. The guards exit. Nizam steps forward and lifts the DAGGER from Dastan’s be His eyes glint with greed as he caresses it..
Thank you Dastan. I’ve been looking for this. Tamina’s eyes widen in horror.
No!
(bloody and beaten) I’m sorry Tamina...

You should be. You stood before the hourglass with the dagger in your hand-- the one blade capable of penetrating the glass nothing in heaven or earth can break. And the limit of your ambition was to turn back time sixty seconds? A trick for a street magician. I will turn back time sixty years.  108.
You can’t! It’s forbidden! Nizam ignores her; continues speaking to Dastan.

Sixty years since the divine right of kingship was granted to the house of Shahraman. I was a child then, as your father was; I had the understanding of a child. Had I known what I know now, I could have acted. An accident at play. Children are fragile; they die so easily.
No!

On such small things empires turn. And so in my fifteenth year, when al-Ma’mun defeated al-Amin, and Babak’s head rolled in the sand at Samarra, I -- not Shahraman-- shall be seated on the throne of Nasaf. And what a king I shall be!
Nizam, it is not for mortals to spill the Sands of Time for personal glory! You could unleash a storm that would wipe mankind off the face of the earth!!
Superstition, girl. A scary tale told to prevent lesser men from reaching for greatness.
Greatness cannot be stolen; it must be earned. You shall never achieve it, Nizam.
On the contrary I shall be the wisest and greatest of rulers. I will lay in stores of grain before the famine, I will build high walls when there is yet no enemy in sight. (MORE )

Under my reign Persia shall rise again to be a great empire.. and I will be Shah-an-Shah, King of Kings, God among men. It’s unfortunate that you will not be born to reap this golden age. Soon, you will never even have existed. (as an afterthought) But first you will be executed. As Nizam leaves he summons the GUARDS.
Unchain the girl. I promised Garsiv he could have her to enjoy. Tamina is freed and dragged away, struggling. As Nizam leaves with her, Dastan rages.

Nizam! Nizam! NIZAM!! He ducks under one of the chains, turning himself around he’s facing the wall with his arms crossed. He repeats th maneuver, each time giving the chains another twist, unti he’s close enough to brace his feet against the wall. The PULLS until he’s screaming in agony.
Dastan is barely conscious. His chains haven’t budged. The distant NOISE of a door closing half-rouses him. Dastan’s lips are parched, his eyes glassy and delirious.
Tamina.. Tamina... Nizam’s guards enter and unchain him from the wall. Dasta is limp and unresisting, unaware of what’s happening.

Prisoners stare through the bars as the guards drag Dasta his execution. The cells are packed with MEN of Alamut, sullen and fierce. Farood, slumped disconsolately in a cell with the other nomads is appalled to recognize Dastan.  110.
Ali?! They got you too? (grieved) Ali, I am sorry. We should never have come to this city! As Dastan passes, Farood grips the bars, shouts--

Tell your Layla that Farood is sorry! Dastan springs into action, revealing that he’s been play possum. Using his chains as weapons, he attacks the guard More guards pour in, shouting for back up. Dastan is a one-man army, fighting six at once in the nar corridor. Unable to rid himself of his chains, he loops t over a ceiling hook and becomes a circus acrobat, spinnin and KICKING off the walls to clobber one guard after anot The prisoners rush to the bars, their shouts adding to th fearsome din. The little Gypsy Boy stares with open-mouth hero worship.
Ali, you amaze me! One unlucky guard, flung against the bars, is grabbed by Farood’s daughters, who tie him in place with his own tur
Get his keys! Nomad hands reach through the bars, frisk the guard.
Nothing! Dastan clobbers another guard, sends him Farood’s way. Th nomad women frisk the guard-- no luck. More soldiers arri making things hotter for Dastan every moment.
Try the fat one there!
Garsiv enters and gazes at Tamina seated on low cushions, wrists bound. Without taking his eyes off of her, he spea to the guard:  111.
Untie her. And leave us.
Dastan fights desperately, outnumbered. Farood comes up triumphantly holding KEYS.
I got it!
So open something!! Farood methodically tries one key after the next to open nomads’ cell, while Dastan battles to stay alive.
Tell me Ali, what was your crime? Dastan doesn’t have time to breathe, much less answer, as dodges a killing blow from another guard.
Ah your hands are full. You will never believe how I came to be in this awful place. Dastan’s in trouble, three guards strangling him with his chains...

I was arrested for selling an overpriced chicken at the market! Ridiculous! How can a chicken be overpriced? It is worth exactly what a man is willing to pay-- ah here it is. Farood unlocks the cell. The nomads swarm out and overwhe the guards, rescuing Dastan in the nick of time. FAROOD’S DAUGHTERS finish them off with savage gusto.

You see? I told you they were strong! Dastan, Farood and the nomads hurry down the corridor, pa cells packed with men of Alamut who rattle the bars and s in Foreign at the escaping prisoners.  112. Dastan pauses on the threshold of freedom. Looks back.
Ali-- come!
No. These men are prisoners because of me. I ama king’s son.

(nods understandingly) A blow on the head can cause such delusions. Fresh air and freedom are the cure. He pulls at Dastan’s arm but Dastan shakes him off. To Farood’s horror, Dastan takes the keys and unlocks the fi cell... With a ROAR, the prisoners charge out. Dastan climbs onto barrel and shouts over the commotion.
Men of Alamut, hear me! It is Dastan, prince of Nasaf, who calls to you! Farood winces-- this delusion is worse than he thought. T men of Alamut react with angry mutters that swell dangerously.

Well may you hate me-- as a foreigner, as an invader. Were I in your place, my blood would cry out for vengeance for your conquered land. Farood is startled as it dawns on him. Dastan is a prince His expression transforms to one of respect and awe.

Yet my land too is conquered-- from within, by a vile usurper. Help me defeat him, and I will give you back your kingdom. I swear it in the name of my father, Shahraman! Dastan pauses for effect. Farood whispers in his ear:  113.

Ali, they don’t understand your language. Dismayed, Dastan surveys his audience, realizes it’s true At that moment several of the Alamut men succeed in smash open the ARMORY. Spears and weapons are passed out. Dasta and Farood are in the center of a hostile, well-armed mob Just then, a battalion of Nasaf SOLDIERS charge in, diver the prisoners’ attention.
(with hand gestures) Fight them! No, them! A full scale battle erupts.
Ali! Well said. Now let’s get out of here. Dastan doesn’t argue this time. Taking advantage of the confusion, they slip out of the melee.

Dastan, Farood and the nomads emerge through a narrow doo onto the citadel embankment, above the river. Farood breathes in the free air-- Dastan pushes him down just in time to dodge a hail of arrows. Nasaf SOLDIERS on horseback ride to intercept the Dastan and the nomad bandits throw themselves into a pitc battle. The Giant Bandit fights three soldiers at once; h plucks one from the saddle and hurls him to an icy fate i the river below. Dastan gets hold of the horse and swings into the saddle.
Farood. Hold them as long as you can.
(offended) Now that you're a king’s son, you are leaving us?  114.
Farood! I need to save her!

Your Layla?! Why didn’t you say so? Dastan smiles and prepares to depart. But suddenly he spo A new wave of NASAF SOLDIERS galloping toward them, practically licking their chops. The nomads will be desperately outnumbered... Dastan hesitates. Then he sees the expression of the Nasaf Soldiers change glee to fear as... The just-liberated Alamut men surge from the prison with terrifying ROAR! Now it’s the turn of Farood’s clan to gr as the tide suddenly turns...
Go! And remember Ali-- your sword belongs to me! Dastan smiles and gallops off.
Guards open the door to an iron CAGE suspended with ropes pulleys over the pit. Nizam steps inside and they begin t lower him toward the hourglass...

head_text.subj: ON A CRY OF PAIN WE CUT TO

text: EXT. COURTYARD, GARSIV’S TENT Garsiv comes reeling out, clutching his cheek where Tamin has clawed deep scratches into his face. A moment later, a pair of GUARDS drag her from the tent, pinned behind her.
She is a demon! I’11 throw her into the pit myself!
He turns as Dastan rides up and leaps from his horse.  115.
You always said you’d beat me if it were a real fight instead of a contest; now’s your chance. Two more GUARDS arrive and fit arrows to their bows, read shoot Dastan. Garsiv holds up a hand.
No. I want to kill him myself. (to Dastan) I’ve waited a long time for this moment, Dastan. And I’m going to let your Slave-Girl live just long enough to watch you die... He draws his sword.

She’s not a Slave-Girl. (draws his sword) She’s a princess. And he charges. The two fighters fall upon one another in fury of steel-on-steel. It’s a perfect match of skill, determination and mutual hatred. Back and forth they battle, trading blows and parries. Dastan is quicker but Garsiv is the stronger. With every blow, Dastan loses a little edge. Garsiv gradually begins force Dastan backwards, toward the edge of the pit... TAMINA struggles against the two Guards holding her tight Garsiv gives Dastan a vicious kick to the stomach that se him to the ground. Garsiv smiles, moving in for the kill.

This is not a tournament Dastan. Your fancy tricks won’t save you now. Dastan scrambles to his feet in time to block the attack he’s on his heels, his back to the edge of the massive pi With a powerful blow, Garsiv knocks Dastan’s sword from h hand. Dastan is helpless, on the brink of the precipice. Garsiv takes one last big, two-handed swing at Dastan, ai to cut him in half. Dastan does an impossible back bend o the pit, like a limbo dancer, hanging by his toes...  116. SWOOSH! Garsiv’s sword slices air inches above Dastan’s nose! His momentum carries Garsiv around like a baseball slugger missing a strike... Dastan spins low on one pivot foot, extending the opposit leg... hitting GARSIV at the back of the knees-- TOPPLING over the cliff edge face forwards! Tamina’s GUARDS step forward with a gasp, as if they coul catch Garsiv.. MISTAKE. Tamina plucks a sword from a Guard’s belt. In a flash, sh strikes them down. The other two Guards turn to face her, warily. Dastan scrambles to his feet and starts to come to her aid--
Never mind me. Nizam is headed for the Hourglass! All will be lost if you don’t stop him! Tamina raises her sword, prepared to fight the two guards Dastan hesitates.
a [o}

With a cranking of wheels, the CAGE comes to a halt in fr of the hourglass. Crumbling rockslides and running water create a non-stop shower of debris falling around the cha and into the abyss. Nizam pays no attention, staring in wonder at the bright sand, inches from his face. He feels the solid glass...
(closes his eyes) This is my destiny... He raises the dagger to strike the hourglass... Suddenly with a great RATTLING NOISE the cage shoots upwa Nizam turns--

No, this is your destiny! --and Dastan clobbers him with both feet, a human counterweight descending on the other end of the rope.  117. Nizam is sent sprawling... the dagger lands on the rocks, of both of their reach. Nizam gets to his feet, scowling. He draws both his sword Dastan draws his one. They square off to duel. Nizam’s two sword technique is unlike any fighting style we've seen. He wields the swords with such skill and dexterity that Dastan struggles to defend himself.

Soon you shall be nothing more than a dream that no one will remember! Nizam presses the pace, attacking from both sides. Dastan makes a last desperate counter-attack and suddenly KNOCKS one of Nizam’s swords from his hand! A beat. New ball game. Nizam swings with his remaining sword-- Dastan blocks the blow confidently. With locked blades, Dastan presses for advantage, his youth and strength coming into play... A look of fear crosses Nizam’s face. Dastan grins.

Not so confident with only one blade? But then.. Dastan coughs. Blood trickles from his mouth. looks down: Nizam has drawn a hidden short sword with his other hand plunged it into Dastan’s side, mortally wounding him. He tricked Dastan.

I always keep a spare. Leaving Dastan to bleed to death, Nizam retrieves the dag Again he approaches the hourglass. And AGAIN, as he is poised to strike, the CAGE flies down Tamina leaps out to stop him.
But this time Nizam is ready. He sidesteps her attack, disarms her and grabs her by the throat. He lifts her bod and holds her over the abyss...  118.

(looks at her) A very pretty face, indeed. Perhaps when you are born thirty years from now I will do you the honor of making you one of my wives... Dastan lifts his head and sees Nizam dangling Tamina.
«but right now you are a nuisance. And with that he releases her!

Noll! Dastan hears her screams echo into the distance as she fa With every last bit of his strength, he pulls himself up. Nizam climbs the steps to the hourglass. He takes out the dagger and raises it high... He strikes! Just then... DASTAN lunges into frame, grabbing his hand to stop him. late. Nizam plunges the dagger into the glass blade-first

Falling rocks and water frozen in midair, Dastan and Niza grappling like two statues, faces contorted-- In the silence resounds a booming NOISE, like ice crackin The CRACK spreads across the surface of the hourglass fro the point where the dagger penetrated it. And-- SAND starts to pour from the crack. TIME RUNS BACKWARD! Rocks and water fly back upward, Tami is returned and ascends again-- the REWIND ACCELERATING a the crack in the hourglass widens, the glowing white SAND pouring out at an ever-faster rate-- DASTAN and NIZAM Are untouched in the eye of the storm, in the blinding LI of the hourglass. Both of their hands are on the dagger.

Becomes a blur through which we catch quick glimpses of action: Dastan fighting Garsiv, Tus’s murder on the bridg Tamina and Dastan’s kiss... All the while, SAND keeps pouring from the hourglass-- no a torrent, swept by the gathering wind into a blinding SANDSTORM that threatens to grow out of control and becom apocalyptic... DASTAN, as if stunned by a concussion, shakes himself awa to realize he’s there with Nizam, in the bright ROARING center of the sandstorm. Nizam, in ecstasy, holds the dagger in place -- SAND pour out of what is no longer the hourglass, but a CRACK in th very surface of the universe. The wind sweeps up the sand it pours out, adding to the storm. Savagely, Nizam pries Dastan’s hand from the dagger. Dast hangs on, too weak to fight back. The wind rips at him; i he lets go, he’ll be sucked into oblivion. Nizam gives Dastan a sharp elbow. Dastan loses his grip a is nearly swept off by the wind-- but he keeps a hold. Dastan looks down, sees blood soaking his tunic. His life ebbing away; he can’t hang on much longer. Then, out of the maelstrom of events REWINDING all around them, an IMPLOSION of light in the dawn sky attracts Dast attention. Hazily looking up, he sees a flaming arrow arc backward through the sky: the opening battle. Dastan summons the last of his strength and will. Bearing down on Nizam’s arm, he PULLS OUT THE DAGGER. In that instant, the crack in the hourglass repairs itsel Before Nizam can recover, the SANDSTORM sweeps both him a Dastan into the void... For a few moments, SAND is all we see and hear. Then, lit by little, the SANDSTORM starts to clear... Dastan looks around. At first he can’t tell where he is. The sand is everywhere. In his teeth, in his hair. He searches himself for the dagger. He doesn’t have it. Gradually he starts to make out other figures nearby. Persian soldiers, shouting in the wind. Horses whinny.. With a shock of dread, Dastan realizes--—  120.
He’s too late. We're reliving the opening battle. The Persian army is already charging toward Alamut-- repeatin the mistake with the inexorability of a nightmare.
No! Nol!
Lashed by sand and wind, the Alamut Sentry grabs a stick beats the gong in warning as he did the first time. INT. TAMINA’S BEDROOM - SUNRISE The GONG awakens Tamina. Sand is blowing into the room.

Tus raises his sword and lets out a WAR CRY, exactly repeating his action of the opening sequence. From the ra rises a blood-curdling noise as thousands of voices join Only one thing has changed: Dastan. Outwardly he’s the same, but his faces shows a new maturity and resolve. He knows what he must do. Dastan looks to the ramparts and sees the flaming arrow launched into the air.
No. He rides toward Tus, shouting--

Tus! Call off the attack! The arrow explodes into a shower of brilliant fireworks, illuminating the scene like a lightning flash. Nizam, on horseback, suddenly blocks Dastan’s way. He strikes, nearly knocking Dastan off his horse. Dastan tries to ride past but Nizam maneuvers to block hi only these two men know what’s at stake.  121. They clash on horseback-- Dastan parries Nizam’s double- bladed attack. The duel begins... while around them the A archers begin to pick off Persian soldiers, creating chao before. Tus, in the vanguard, looks around and sees-- Dastan and Nizam dueling. His face contorts with anger.
Dastan. He does not know why his hot-headed younger brother is fighting with Nizam, but he knows Dastan’s immaturity is jeopardizing the battle. Enraged, Tus rides back...
fight furiously. As before, Dastan’s on the defensive. A growing circle of onlookers gathers, uncertain whether to intervene.
(to the men) Traitor! The King’s son would betray us to our enemy!

He’s lying! The battlefield around them is chaos-- soldiers felled by arrows, catapults erupting in FLAMES. Nizam’s personal guards ride toward the dueling pair. A handful of common footsoldiers block their way with spear

Oh no. This stays a fair fight. In a bold and desperate move, Dastan stands up on his sad and launches himself at Nizam, knocking him off his horse They roll together on the ground. Nizam lands on his back Dastan straddling him, sword raised-- Tus arrives on horseback, forcing his way through the cir
Hold! HOLD!! Dastan freezes, inches from killing Nizam. He can’t disob his brother.  122. Nizam’s right hand creeps along the ground, toward his sw that landed inches away...
Tus, call off the attack! It’s a trick. Nizam lied to us.
We can win. Dastan is a traitor.
Dastan, put down your sword.
No. Tus can’t believe Dastan’s insubordination.
What did you say?
We have no reason to attack Alamut. Our victory will bring us disaster. Menacingly, Tus draws his own sword.

We are at war-- and I command. Put down your sword. The threat is clear. Still Dastan hesitates. Nizam sees his chance. His right hand closes on his sword hilt; he swings upward at Dastan’s neck-- Dastan sees the sword coming, BLOCKS it-- As Nizam expected: he pulls out the hidden short sword wi his OTHER hand and strikes toward Dastan’s exposed torso- But this time Dastan knows it’s coming: with blinding spe Dastan turns, BLOCKS the second blow, and drives his swor like a stake into Nizam’s heart. The men watching are stunned. Nizam can’t believe it eith He coughs. And then he’s dead. Dastan hurls his sword away from him; it sticks quivering the frozen ground. He stands to face Tus.  123.
Kill me if you must. But call off the attack-- for Alamut is blameless. Dastan advances, making it easier for Tus to kill him.
Tus, do you remember Father’s words to you on a the day we left for war? ‘A king must listen always to the voice of reason.’
(mystified) How could...?
‘..but also listen to your heart.’ Tus stares at him. Dastan meets his gaze, calmly resolute This is not the younger brother he knew. It’s as if Dasta matured overnight. Tus turns and shouts--
Halt! Retreat! His orders echo through the ranks, repeated by the comman at every level.

An Alamut PRIEST takes the dagger from an ornate box and about to entrust it to the Fearsome armored Warrior when- Alamut soldiers come running bearing news, shouting. The Priest looks out over a parapet. Below, the great wave of men moving toward the castle has stopped. The Persian army is turning around. The Priest looks at the dagger in his hand... utters a si PRAYER of thanks, and replaces it in its box.  124.
Tamina, in her nightgown, watches through a loophole as t army vanishes into the mist. On her young face is a vague sense of the danger she’s just escaped.
A Persian delegation, Tus, the twins, Dastan and forty soldiers, marches past Alamut soldiers standing at attent The King of Alamut and his court awaits them on a dais.

(bows formally) From my father, King Shahraman. An ATTENDANT steps forward bearing a chest; an INTERPRETE repeats Tus’s words in Foreign. The King responds in kind As the formalities drag on, Dastan slips away from his brothers. As he edges over towards the temple, he tries t catch the eye of... TAMINA, resplendent in full regalia, standing amongst a g of Alamut NOBLEWOMEN. She notices the young Prince lookin at her.. he smiles! She blushes and turns away, giggling with one of her LADIES-IN-WAITING. But she glances back anyway... On the dais, Tus and the King of Alamut embrace in ritual friendship. A murmur runs through the crowd. The Twins lean together for a private aside.
I hope he doesn’t make us marry his daughter.
Make you marry her.

No, you. The sound of a SPLASH and a following commotion turns the heads. The Twins are greatly amused to see that: DASTAN has somehow fallen into the SACRED FOUNTAIN. He’s being helped out by an irritated Alamut Priest.  125. Tus shakes his head in embarrassment: his younger brother at it again. The King waves it off indulgently. Dastan emerges, dripping wet, with a big grin on his face He looks right at-- TAMINA, unable to suppress a smile of amusement and curiosity. Dastan gets a glimmer in his eyes. He winks at her, as if the two of them share a secret... FADE OUT.
